data.title: Braille Rosetta Stone
data.statement:
Braille is a system of raised dots that can be read with the fingers by people who are blind or who have low vision.

Each lowercase letter consists of a 2 x 3 grid, which this puzzle represents with {{.}} and {{o}}

For example {{s}} is this in braille:
`.o
o.
o.`
Letters are divided by a single space.

You will be given a phrase in English ([[phrase1]]) and its equivalent in braille.

You will then be given a different phrase in braille.  Your task is to translate it into English ([[phrase2]]).

testCases.title: Test 1 - simple
testCases.testIn:
quick brown
oo o. .o oo o. .. o. o. o. .o oo
oo .. o. .. .. .. o. oo .o oo .o
o. oo .. .. o. .. .. o. o. .o o.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
o. o. .o oo o.
o. oo o. .. ..
.. o. .. .. o.

o. o. oo oo o.
o. .. .o .. .o

data.constraints:
‣ all characters in [[phrase2]] are in [[phrase1]]
‣ [[phrase1]] and [[phrase2]] consist of only lowercase letters and spaces (no punctuation)
data.stubGenerator:
read phrase1:string(1000)
read phrase1BrailleTopRow:string(3000)
read phrase1BrailleMidRow:string(3000)
read phrase1BrailleBotRow:string(3000)
read dividingLine:string(16)
read phrase2BrailleTopRow:string(3000)
read phrase2BrailleMidRow:string(3000)
read phrase2BrailleBotRow:string(3000)
write phrase2
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[phrase1]]
<<Lines 2-4:>> strings, 3 rows that together represent [[phrase1]] in braille
<<Line 5:>> a string, simply a dividing line for easier readability 
<<Lines 6-8:>> strings, 3 rows that together represent [[phrase2]] in braille

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Braille is a system of raised dots that can be read with the fingers by people who are blind or who have low vision.

Each lowercase letter consists of a 2 x 3 grid, which this puzzle represents with . and o

For example s is this in braille:
.o
o.
o.

Letters are divided by a single space.

You will be given a phrase in English (phrase1) and its equivalent in braille.

You will then be given a different phrase in braille. Your task is to translate it into English (phrase2).
Input
Line 1: phrase1
Lines 2-4: strings, 3 rows that together represent phrase1 in braille
Line 5: a string, simply a dividing line for easier readability
Lines 6-8: strings, 3 rows that together represent phrase2 in braille
Output
Line 1: phrase2
Constraints
‣ all characters in phrase2 are in phrase1
‣ phrase1 and phrase2 consist of only lowercase letters and spaces (no punctuation)
Example
Input
quick brown
oo o. .o oo o. .. o. o. o. .o oo
oo .. o. .. .. .. o. oo .o oo .o
o. oo .. .. o. .. .. o. o. .o o.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
o. o. .o oo o.
o. oo o. .. ..
.. o. .. .. o.
Output
brick
